course_name: Honours Research Project in Veterinary Technology
description:
This course allows veterinary technicians to undertake their own research project under the supervision of an experienced academic. With the help of their supervisor, students will design a study, collect and analyse data and write up their study as a small thesis. They will also present their study as a seminar to their peers and academics. This will provide the student with an appreciation of the research process and the concept of evidence-based medicine that underpins clinical practice. Students also receive training in research skills that enables them to pursue further research study. 

Students commencing in Semester 1 full-time enrol in VETS6631 for 2 consecutive semesters. Students commencing in Semester 2 full-time enrol in VETS6632 for 2 consecutive semesters.
prerequisites: Bachelor of Veterinary Technology or equivalent
